intro: Centotheca urekana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf centotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Centotheca urekana is often found in fynbos vegetation, which is a unique type of shrubland ecosystem.
